title: Cannot get in touch with Google Store/Support for my Pixel 2
content:
The USB-C port of my Pixel 2 is very loose - the charger (or headphones via USB-C adapter) barely connect. I have tried 2 official Google Pixel charges, third-party chargers, and Lenovo laptop chargers, but only 1 charger does work, but only have 10 minutes of fiddling and it's very sensitive: touching it once and the connection is lost. Impact:
No charging in the car, or connecting the car (as that is vertical)
Extremely difficult to charge and only with 1 specific charger
Only able to use bluetooth headphones

I have tried multiple chargers and cleaning the port (e.g., used the air spray in a can to try to clean it). Dirt seems not to be the issue - I believe it's a hardware problem thus within warranty.

The problem lies in contacting Google Support: I purchased the Pixel 2 whilst I was still living in the UK, directly via the UK Google Store. I am living in the Netherlands now where the Pixel 2 is not sold in the Google Store. I don't know how to contact Google, I tried:
Via my Pixel 2, via Settings > Support. There is only a call back option. I have typed a message 3 times now, but not called back (first try was several weeks ago)
I looked online to any contact possibilities but found none
I found a phone number of Google Support in the Netherlands (https://support.google.com/store/answer/6178715#contact=1), but the number is invalid and not working

My question is: How do I contact Google Support to help me with my Pixel 2 issue?

Thank you,
Remco
